text: <@U24M29R4G> - any more luck w/docker outside of vagrant?  is your target host environment running on windows or a mac?
<@U0YQQRNU8> my target host env is running on Ubuntu 14.04. I am not able to get around the issue of the validators exiting with a 127 error code.
any additional error text?
if you use -vv it should show you the docker run command being used
you can run that directly for debugging
<@U24M29R4G|nikileshsa> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/nikileshsa/F3EBYN86B/docker_with_debugging_options___.sh|docker with debugging options...>

file.name: docker_with_debugging_options___.sh
file.title: docker with debugging options...
file.preview:
chain@chain:~/projects$ sawtooth cluster start -m docker --count 4 -vv
Starting: validator-000
Starting: validator-001
Starting: validator-002
Starting: validator-003
file.preview_highlight:
chain@chain:~/projects$ sawtooth cluster start -m docker --count 4 -vv
Starting: validator-000
Starting: validator-001
Starting: validator-002
Starting: validator-003

text: <@U0YQQRNU8> sorry was away.... thanks for sharing the debugging options.. I have posted the debug log with -vv above..
<@U24M29R4G> also to get more information you can "docker logs validator-002"
<@U1L6PRGTF> thanks.. will try that..
<@U24M29R4G|nikileshsa> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/nikileshsa/F3D19B2FJ/docker_logs_for_the_validators__.sh|docker logs for the validators..>

file.name: docker_logs_for_the_validators__.sh
file.title: docker logs for the validators..
file.preview:
chain@chain:/project/sawtooth-core$ docker logs validator-000
bash: /project/sawtooth-core/validator/data/validator-000.json: No such file or directory
bash: /project/sawtooth-core/bin/sawtooth: No such file or directory
bash: /project/sawtooth-core/bin/sawtooth: No such file or directory
bash: /project/sawtooth-core/bin/txnvalidator: No such file or directory
file.preview_highlight:
chain@chain:/project/sawtooth-core$ docker logs validator-000
bash: /project/sawtooth-core/validator/data/validator-000.json: No such file or directory
bash: /project/sawtooth-core/bin/sawtooth: No such file or directory
bash: /project/sawtooth-core/bin/sawtooth: No such file or directory
bash: /project/sawtooth-core/bin/txnvalidator: No such file or directory

text: try 'docker run -it validator-001 bash' and then when you are in the container 'ls  -l /project/sawtooth-core/bin/txnvalidator' to give the long listing of that file.
<@U1L6PRGTF> the container doesn't have a folder by name /project in the first place.
<@U24M29R4G> - so, /project is mounted as ../ on the host as a volume
ah - -v /project:/project
so, it's actually mounting /project to /project
so that's the issue, on your host system, you don't have /project. so we will  need a better way to do that.
for now, you could probably create a link for it
oh ok. got it.. thanks <@U0YQQRNU8>... thats the issue..
that resolved the issue.. thanks much <@U0YQQRNU8>  and <@U1L6PRGTF>
Glad to help, <@U24M29R4G>
<@U0NF7DF2A|todd_mcd_r3> has joined the channel
<@U0YQQRNU8> Could you please take a look at <https://github.com/hyperledger/sawtooth-core/pull/40>,  Running ./bin/run_tests totally costs too much time, this PR could run tests of specified module.
